questions.question:
While conducting an audit of a service provider for a government program involving confidential information,
an information systems (IS) auditor noted that the service provider delegated a part of the IS work to another
subcontractor. Which of the following provides the MOST assurance that the requirements for protecting
confidentiality of information are met?

options.A: Monthly committee meetings include the subcontractor^ IS manager.
options.B: Management reviews weekly reports from the subcontractor.
options.C: Permission is obtained from the government agent regarding the contract.
options.D: Periodic independent audits are performed of the work delegated to the subcontractor.

justifications.A:
Regular committee meetings are a good monitoring tool for delegated operations; however, independent
reviews provide better assurance.
justifications.B: Management should not rely only on self-reported information from the subcontractor.
justifications.C:
Obtaining permission from the government agent is not related to ensuring the confidentiality of
information.
justifications.D:
Periodic independent audits provide reasonable assurance that the requirements for protecting
confidentiality of information are not compromised.

questions.question:
During an audit, which of the following situations are MOST concerning for an organization that significantly
outsources information systems (IS) processing to a private network?

options.A: The contract does not contain a right-to-audit clause for the third party.
options.B: The contract was not reviewed by an information security subject matter expert prior to signing.
options.C: The IS outsourcing guidelines are not approved by the board of directors.
options.D: There is a lack of well-defined IS performance evaluation procedures.

justifications.A:
In the case of outsourcing to a private network, the organization should ensure that the third party
has a minimum set of IT security controls in place and that they are operating effectively. The
absence of a right-to-audit clause in the contract impacts the information systems (IS) auditor's
ability to perform the IS audit Hence, the IS auditor is most concerned with such a situation.
justifications.B:
Having an information security subject matter expert review a contract is a good practice, but it is not a
requirement in all industries.
justifications.C:
Approval of the IS outsourcing guidelines by the board is a good practice of governance, and lack of
approval is an audit issue. However, it does not impact the IS auditor's ability to perform the IS audit.
justifications.D:
Lack of well-defined procedures does not enable objective evaluation of IS performance and is an audit
issue. However, it does not result in major risk or repercussions and does not impact the IS auditor's
ability to perform an IS audit.
162

questions.question: The MOST important element for the effective design of an information security policy is the:

options.A: threat landscape.
options.B: prior security incidents.
options.C: emerging technologies.
options.D: enterprise risk appetite.

justifications.A:
The threat landscape is dynamic. It should be considered when developing policy, but it is not the primary
factor because policy is not meant to change as often as the threat landscape.
justifications.B:
Prior security incidents may provide insight into the risk appetite statement; however, they are more likely
to affect security standards and procedures.
justifications.C:
Emerging technologies are continually evolving. They should be considered when developing policy, but
they are not the primary factor because policy is not meant to change as often as technology.
justifications.D:
The risk appetite is the amount of risk on a broad level that an entity is willing to accept in pursuit
of its mission to meet its strategic objectives. The purpose of the information security policy is to
manage information risk to an acceptable level, so that the policy is principally aligned with the risk
appetite.

questions.question:
Due to profitability pressure, senior management of an enterprise decided to keep investments in information
security at an inadequate level. Which of the following is the BEST recommendation for an information
systems (IS) auditor?

options.A: Use cloud providers for low-risk operations.
options.B: Revise compliance enforcement processes.
options.C: Request that senior management accept the risk.
options.D: Postpone low-priority security procedures.

justifications.A:
Cloud computing is cost-effective because costs that are usually directed at purchasing software and
hardware are immediately eliminated. However, other costs need to be monitored closely, such as data
transfer cost, cloud utilization cost, migration cost and business process reengineering cost. Therefore, the
use of cloud providers may or may not provide cost savings or lower risk.
justifications.B:
Compliance enforcement processes that identify high levels of residual risk are working as intended and
should not be revised.
justifications.C:
Senior management determines resource allocations. Having established that the level of security is
inadequate, it is imperative that senior management accept the risk resulting from their decisions.
justifications.D:
The information systems (IS) auditor should not recommend postponing any procedures. This is a
management decision, and management should first accept the risk.
163

questions.question: Which of the following insurance types provide for a loss arising from fraudulent acts by employees?

options.A: Business interruption
options.B: Fidelity coverage
options.C: Errors and omissions
options.D: Extra expense

justifications.A:
Business interruption insurance covers the loss of profit due to the disruption in the operations of an
organization.
justifications.B: Fidelity insurance covers the loss arising from dishonest or fraudulent acts by employees.
justifications.C:
Errors and omissions insurance provides legal liability protection if the professional practitioner commits
an act that results in financial loss to a client.
justifications.D:
Extra expense insurance is designed to cover the extra costs of continuing operations following a disaster/
disruption within an organization.

questions.question: Errors in audit procedures PRIMARILY impact which type of risk?

options.A: Detection risk
options.B: Inherent risk
options.C: Control risk
options.D: Business risk

justifications.A:
Detection risk is a component of audit risk and is the probability that the audit procedures may fail
to detect the existence of a material error or fraud.
justifications.B:
Inherent risk in auditing refers to the risk involved in the nature of business or transaction. It is not
affected by human error and is a component of audit risk.
justifications.C:
Control risk is a component of audit risk and is the risk that a material error exists that would not be
prevented or detected on a timely basis by the system of internal controls.
justifications.D:
Business risk is a broad category that includes strategic risk, compliance risk, operational risk and
reputational risk. It applies to any event or circumstance that has the potential to prevent an enterprise
from achieving its business goals or objectives and is not a component of audit risk.
164

questions.question:
Which of the following is MOST important to consider when reviewing the classification levels of
information assets?

options.A: Potential loss
options.B: Financial cost
options.C: Potential threats
options.D: Cost of insurance

justifications.A:
The best basis for asset classification is an understanding of the total losses that a business may
incur if the asset is compromised. Typically, estimating these losses requires a review of criticality
and sensitivity beyond financial cost, such as operational and strategic.
justifications.B: The value of an asset can be greater than its monetary cost, such as impact on reputation and brand.
justifications.C: The classification of an asset does not change based on potential threats.
justifications.D: Insurance is obtained based on asset classification.

questions.question:
Which of the following is of MOST interest to an information systems (IS) auditor who is reviewing an
organization's risk strategy?

options.A: All risk is mitigated effectively.
options.B: Residual risk is zero after control implementation.
options.C: All likely risk is identified and ranked.
options.D: The organization uses an established risk framework.

justifications.A:
It is not possible to mitigate all existing risk. However, risk needs to be identified and ranked before
effective mitigation can be implemented.
justifications.B:
It is highly unlikely that residual risk would be zero, but it can be reduced. There will always be some
level of risk remaining. This is known as residual risk.
justifications.C:
Risk that is likely to impact the organization should be identified, ranked and documented as part
of the risk strategy. Without knowing the risk, there is no risk strategy.
justifications.D:
It is not as important to use an established risk framework as it is to identify and rank all likely risk so that
it can be addressed.
165

questions.question:
After an organization completed a threat and vulnerability analysis as part of a risk assessment, the final report
suggested that an intrusion prevention system (IPS) should be installed at the main Internet gateways and that
all business units should be separated via a proxy firewall. Which of the following is the BEST method to
determine whether the controls should be implemented?

options.A: Cost-benefit analysis
options.B: Annual loss expectancy calculation
options.C: Comparison of the cost of the IPS and firewall and the cost of the business systems
options.D: Business impact analysis (BIA)

justifications.A:
In a cost-benefit analysis, the total expected purchase and operational/support costs, and a
qualitative value for all actions are weighed against the total expected benefits to choose the best
technical, most profitable, least expensive or acceptable risk option.
justifications.B:
The annual loss expectancy is the expected monetary loss that is estimated for an asset over a one-year
period. It is a useful calculation that should be included in determining the necessity of controls but is not
sufficient alone.
justifications.C:
The cost of the hardware assets should be compared to the total value of the information that the asset
protects, including the cost of the systems where the data reside and across which data are transmitted.
This comparison is useful as part of the cost-benefit analysis, but not sufficient on its own to determine
whether the controls should be implemented.
justifications.D:
A business impact analysis (BIA) predicts the consequences of disruption of a business function and
process and gathers information needed to develop recovery strategies. The BIA is only one part of the
cost-benefit analysis.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor is reviewing a contract management process to determine the financial
viability of a software vendor for a critical business application. An IS auditor should determine whether the
vendor being considered:

options.A: can deliver on the immediate contract.
options.B: is of similar financial standing as the organization.
options.C: has significant financial obligations that can impose liability to the organization.
options.D: can support the organization in the long term.

justifications.A:
The capability of the organization to support the enterprise should extend beyond the time of execution of
the immediate contract. The objective of a financial evaluation should not be confined to the immediate
contract but should be to provide assurance of sustainability over a longer time frame.
justifications.B: Whether the vendor is of similar financial standing as the purchaser is irrelevant to this review.
justifications.C:
The vendor should not have financial obligations that can impose a liability to the purchaser; the financial
obligations are usually from the purchaser to the vendor.
justifications.D:
The long-term financial viability of a vendor is essential for deriving maximum value for the
organization一it is more likely that a financially sound vendor will be in business for a long period
of time and thereby more likely to be capable of providing long-term support for the purchased
product.
167

questions.question:
Which of the following is the BEST way to ensure that organizational policies comply with legal
requirements?

options.A: Inclusion of a blanket legal statement in each policy
options.B: Periodic review by subject matter experts
options.C: Annual sign-off by senior management on organizational policies
options.D: Policy alignment to the most restrictive regulations

justifications.A:
A blanket legal statement in each policy to adhere to all applicable laws and regulations is ineffective
because the readers of the policy (internal personnel) will not know which statements are applicable or
the specific nature of their requirements. As a result, personnel may lack the knowledge to perform the
required activities for legal compliance.
justifications.B:
Periodic review of policies by personnel with specific knowledge of regulatory and legal
requirements best ensures that organizational policies are aligned with legal requirements.
justifications.C:
Annual sign-off by senior management on an organization's policies helps set the tone at the top but does
not ensure that the policies comply with regulatory and legal requirements.
justifications.D:
Aligning policies to the most restrictive regulations may create an unacceptable financial burden for the
organization. This can then lead to securing minimal risk systems to the same degree as those containing
sensitive customer data and other information protected by legislation.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor is reviewing the risk management process. Which of the following is the
MOST important consideration during this review?

options.A: Controls are implemented based on cost-benefit analysis.
options.B: The risk management framework is based on global standards.
options.C: The approval process for risk response is in place.
options.D: IT risk is presented in business terms.

justifications.A:
Controls to mitigate risk must be implemented based on cost-benefit analysis; however, the cost-benefit
analysis is effective only if risk is presented in business terms.
justifications.B:
A risk management framework based on global standards helps in ensuring completeness; however,
organizations must adapt it to suit specific business requirements.
justifications.C: Approvals for risk response come later in the process.
justifications.D:
For risk management to be effective, it is necessary to align IT risk with business objectives. This
can be done by adopting acceptable terminology that is understood by all, and the best way to
achieve this is to present IT risk in business terms.
168 CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manuall3th Edition

questions.question:
An enterprise hosts its data center onsite and has outsourced the management of its key financial applications
to a service provider. Which of the following controls BEST ensures that the service provider's employees
adhere to the security policies?

options.A: Sign-off is required on the enterprise's security policies for all users.
options.B: An indemnity clause is included in the contract with the service provider.
options.C: Mandatory security awareness training is implemented for all users.
options.D: Security policies should be modified to address compliance by third-party users.

justifications.A:
Having users sign off on policies is a good practice; however, this only puts the onus of compliance on the
individual user, not on the organization.
justifications.B:
Having the service provider sign an indemnity clause ensures compliance with the enterprise's
security policies, because any violations discovered will lead to a financial liability for the service
provider. This will also prompt the enterprise to monitor security violations closely.
justifications.C:
Awareness training is an excellent control but does not ensure that the service provider's employees
adhere to policy.
justifications.D:
Modification of security policy does not ensure compliance by users unless the policies are appropriately
communicated to users and enforced, and awareness training is provided.

questions.question:
The corporate IT policy for a call center requires that all users be assigned unique user accounts. On
discovering that this is not the case for all current users, what is the MOST appropriate recommendation?

options.A: Have the current configuration approved by operations management.
options.B: Ensure that there is an audit trail for all existing accounts.
options.C: Implement individual user accounts for all staff.
options.D: Amend the IT policy to allow shared accounts.

justifications.A:
Having the current configuration approved is a recommendation that is not in compliance with the
enterprise's own policy and violates good practice.
justifications.B:
Having an audit trail for existing shared accounts does not provide accountability or resolve the problem
of noncompliance with policy.
justifications.C:
Individual user accounts allow for accountability of transactions and should be the most important
recommendation, given the current scenario.
justifications.D:
Shared user accounts do not allow for accountability of transactions and do not reflect good practice.
169

questions.question: Which of the following reasons BEST describes the purpose of a mandatory vacation policy?

options.A: To ensure that employees are properly cross-trained in multiple functions.
options.B: To improve employee morale.
options.C: To identify potential errors or inconsistencies in business processes.
options.D: To be used as a cost-saving measure.

justifications.A:
Ensuring that employees are properly cross-trained in multiple functions improves the skills of employees
and provides for succession planning but is not the primary purpose of mandatory vacations.
justifications.B:
Improving employee morale helps in reducing employee burnout but is not the primary reason for
mandatory vacations.
justifications.C:
Mandatory vacations help uncover potential fraud or inconsistencies. Ensuring that people who
have access to sensitive internal controls or processes take a mandatory vacation annually is often a
regulatory requirement and, most importantly, a good way to uncover fraud.
justifications.D:
Mandatory vacations may or may not be a cost-saving measure, depending on the enterprise, but saving
cost is not the primary purpose for the policy.

questions.question:
The MOST important point of consideration for an information systems (IS) auditor while reviewing an
enterprise's project portfolio is that it:

options.A: does not exceed the existing IT budget.
options.B: is aligned with the investment strategy.
options.C: has been approved by the IT steering committee.
options.D: is aligned with the business plan.

justifications.A:
Managing the project portfolio within the agreed budget is important, and it should be identified if the
project portfolio exceeds the IT budget. However, it is not as critical as ensuring that it is aligned with the
business plan.
justifications.B:
Project portfolio alignment has an explicit directive and strategic goal in aligning existing projects to
business strategies and ensuring continuous alignment to continue investing in the properly aligned
projects and portfolios. Thus, the project portfolio should be aligned with the investment strategy, but it is
more important that it is aligned with the business plan.
justifications.C:
Appropriate approval of the project portfolio should be granted. However, not every enterprise has an IT
steering committee, and this is not as critical as ensuring that the projects are aligned with the business
plan.
justifications.D:
Portfolio management takes a holistic view of an enterprise's overall IT strategy, which, in turn,
should be aligned with the business strategy. A business plan provides the justification for each of
the projects in the project portfolio, and that is the major consideration for an information systems
(IS) auditor.
170

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor observes that an enterprise has outsourced software development to a
third-party start-up organization. To ensure that the enterprise's investment in software is protected, which of
the following should be recommended by the IS auditor?

options.A: Due diligence should be performed on the software vendor.
options.B: A quarterly audit of the vendor facilities should be performed.
options.C: There should be a source code escrow agreement in place.
options.D: A high penalty clause should be included in the contract.

justifications.A:
Vendor due diligence is the way in which organizations vet their vendors to spot potential red flags,
before entering a contractual relationship. Although due diligence is a good practice, it does not ensure
availability of the source code in the event of vendor failure.
justifications.B:
A quarterly audit of vendor facilities is a good practice to continuously evaluate the vendor, but it does
not ensure availability of the source code in the event of failure of the start-up vendor.
justifications.C:
The objective of source code escrow is to ensure continued availability of software support and
maintenance. Thus, it is primarily recommended to help protect the enterprise's investment in
software, because the source code will be available through a trusted third party and can be
retrieved if the start-up vendor goes out of business.
justifications.D:
A penalty clause imposes a fine on a guilty party for breaching contractual terms. Although it is good
practice to include it in the contract, it does not provide protection or ensure availability of the source
code in the event of vendor bankruptcy.

questions.question: Enterprise risk appetite is BEST established by:

options.A: the chief legal officer (CLO).
options.B: security management.
options.C: the audit committee.
options.D: the board of directors.

justifications.A:
The chief legal officer (CLO) is mandated to ensure that the legal risk of the enterprise is minimized.
Although CLOs can give guidance regarding legal issues on the policy, they cannot determine the risk
appetite.
justifications.B:
Security management covers all aspects of protecting an organization's assets, including computers,
people, buildings and other assets, against risk. The security management team is therefore concerned
with managing the security posture but not with determining the posture.
justifications.C:
The primary purpose of the audit committee is to provide oversight of the financial reporting process, the
audit process, the company's system of internal controls and compliance with laws and regulations. The
audit committee is not responsible for setting the risk tolerance or appetite of the enterprise.
justifications.D:
Risk appetite is set by the board of directors and should align with strategic objectives that the
enterprise wants to achieve. Strategic objectives and/or highly ambitious targets that are more
difficult to reach typically require a higher risk appetite.
171

questions.question:
A financial services enterprise has a small IT department, and individuals perform more than one role. Which
of the following practices represents the GREATEST risk?

options.A: The developers promote code into the production environment.
options.B: The business analyst writes the requirements and performs functional testing.
options.C: The IT manager also performs systems administration.
options.D: The database administrator (DBA) also performs data backups.

justifications.A:
Developers with access to the production environment may run unauthorized code or migrate
untested code to production resulting in system unavailability.
justifications.B:
In situations in which there is no dedicated testing group, the business analyst is often the one to perform
testing because the analyst has detailed knowledge of how the system must function because of writing
the requirements.
justifications.C:
It is acceptable in a small team for the IT manager to perform system administration, if the manager does
not also develop code.
justifications.D:
The primary function of a database administrator (DBA) is to implement, maintain, optimize and manage
database structures for the enterprise. Therefore, it may be part of the DBA's duties to perform data
backups.

questions.question:
A financial enterprise has had difficulties establishing clear responsibilities between its IT strategy committee
and its IT steering committee. Which of the following responsibilities would MOST likely be assigned to its
IT steering committee?

options.A: Approving IT project plans and budgets
options.B: Aligning IT to business objectives
options.C: Advising on IT compliance risk
options.D: Promoting IT governance practices

justifications.A:
An IT steering committee typically has a variety of responsibilities, including approving IT project
plans and budgets. Issues related to business objectives, risk and governance are responsibilities
that are generally assigned to an IT strategy committee because it provides insight and advice to the
board.
justifications.B:
Aligning IT to business objectives is a task usually assigned to an IT strategy committee. The steering
committee is more involved in approval and monitoring of individual projects and budgets.
justifications.C:
Issues related to IT compliance risk are tasks usually assigned to an IT strategy committee. The steering
committee is more involved in approval and monitoring of individual projects and budgets.
justifications.D:
IT governance is a task usually assigned to an IT strategy committee. The steering committee is more
involved in approval and monitoring of individual projects and budgets.
172

questions.question: Which of the following is the BEST enabler for strategic alignment between business and IT?

options.A: Maturity model
options.B: Goals and metrics
options.C: Control objectives
options.D: Responsible, accountable, consulted, informed (RACI) chart

justifications.A:
Maturity models enable assessment of current process capability and can be used for process
improvement and measuring the maturity of the alignment process, but they do not directly enable
strategic alignment.
justifications.B:
Goals and metrics ensure that IT goals are set based on business goals, and they are the best
enablers of strategic alignment.
justifications.C:
Control objectives are statements that address how risk is going to be effectively managed by an
organization. Control objectives, therefore, facilitate the implementation of controls in the related
processes according to business requirements.
justifications.D:
Responsible, accountable, consulted, informed (RACI) charts enable the assignment of responsibility to
key function areas but do not ensure strategic alignment.

questions.question: An IT steering committee should:

options.A: include a mix of members from different departments and staff levels.
options.B: ensure that information security policies and procedures have been executed properly.
options.C: maintain minutes of its meetings and keep the board of directors informed.
options.D: be briefed about new trends and products at each meeting by a vendor.

justifications.A:
Only senior management or high-level staff members should be on this committee because of its strategic
mission. Each member should have the authority to make decisions within the group for his/her respective
areas.
justifications.B:
Ensuring that information security policies and procedures have been executed properly is not the
responsibility of this committee, but the responsibility of IT management and the security administrator.
justifications.C:
It is important to keep detailed IT steering committee minutes to document the decisions and
activities of the IT steering committee. The board of directors should be informed about those
decisions on a timely basis.
justifications.D:
A vendor should be invited to meetings only when appropriate.
173

questions.question: Which of the following would BEST facilitate the successful implementation of an IT-related framework?

options.A: Documenting IT-related policies and procedures
options.B: Ensuring the appropriate business representation within the framework
options.C: Following the latest industry best practices to implement the framework
options.D: Creating a committee to oversee the framework implementation

justifications.A:
Documenting IT-related policies and procedures is part of the implementation of the framework; it does
not guarantee a successful implementation.
justifications.B:
Ensuring the appropriate business representation in the IT framework is the best way to align IT
framework with business.
justifications.C:
Regardless of the chosen framework, alignment with business processes is the key to successful
implementation.
justifications.D:
Creating a committee to oversee the framework implementation is a good effort, but if there is no
representation from the business, the framework will not be successful.

questions.question: Who is ULTIMATELY responsible for data classification and protection?

options.A: Data steward
options.B: Data custodian
options.C: Data owner
options.D: Data controller

justifications.A:
Data custodians are responsible for storing and safeguarding the data and include information security
personnel, such as systems analysts and computer operators.
justifications.B:
Data stewards are oversight or data governance roles within an organization and are responsible for
ensuring the quality and fitness for the purpose of the organization's data assets, including the metadata
for those data assets.
justifications.C:
Data owners are responsible for data classification and protection. Their security responsibilities
include authorizing access, ensuring that access rules are updated when personnel changes occur
and regularly reviewing access rules for the data for which they are responsible.
justifications.D:
The data controllers determine the purposes for which and how data are processed.
174

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor has been tasked by an automated manufacturing facility for the risk-based
audit of its distributed control supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) systems. Which of the
following should be the PRIMARY task for the auditor?

options.A: Evaluation of communication architecture and connectivity interfaces
options.B: Evaluation of functioning of monitoring terminals, sensors and actuators
options.C: Assessment of total cost of ownership (TCO) for the SCADA systems
options.D: Evaluation of usability of automated controls for enterprise engineers

justifications.A:
Communication channels over the Internet and even USB interfaces in air-gapped systems increase
the risk of malware exposure (e.g.，Stuxnet).
justifications.B: Monitors, sensors and actuator evaluation is not of the same gravity in risk-based audit as communication.
justifications.C:
Evaluation of total cost of ownership (TCO)/cost-effectiveness is not the primary concern to an
information systems (IS) auditor compared to malware exposure.
justifications.D: Usability evaluation is of lesser evaluation in the risk-based audit.

questions.question:
During an audit, the infDrmation systems (IS) auditor observed that a user can log in to post a transaction
and then change role to authorize the same. Which of the following is the BEST course of action for the IS
auditor?

options.A: Ask the system administrator to suspend the user's access.
options.B: Check for suitable compensating controls.
options.C: Ask the database administrator to merge the two roles into a single role.
options.D: Record the finding in the audit report.

justifications.A: The information systems (IS) auditor cannot recommend suspending the user's access.
justifications.B:
If a violation of segregation/separation of duties (SoD) is observed, the IS auditor should first look
for compensating controls before concluding the findings.
justifications.C:
An IS auditor would not recommend merging the two roles into a single role, because that is a violation of
SoD.
justifications.D:
D. The IS auditor identifies and evaluates all controls before recording findings.

questions.question: Which of the following is the PRIMARY objective of an enterprise architecture (EA) framework?

options.A: To provide a business case for developing and implementing IT systems and applications
options.B: To manage IT-related risk and ensure compliance with legal and regulatory requirements
options.C: To ensure the efficient and effective use of IT resources and capabilities
options.D: To align IT with business objectives and strategy and facilitate decision making and innovation

justifications.A:
Providing a blueprint for developing and implementing IT systems is an important aspect of enterprise
architecture (EA), but it is not the primary objectives.
justifications.B:
Although EA can also help manage IT-related risk and ensure compliance with legal and regulatory
requirements, these are not the primary objectives of an EA framework.
justifications.C:
Ensuring the efficient and effective use of IT resources and capabilities is also an important aspect of EA,
but it is not the primary objective.
justifications.D:
EA provides a holistic and integrated view of the enterprise's IT architecture and aligns IT
with its business objectives and strategy. The primary objective of EA is to facilitate decision
making, innovation and agility by providing a comprehensive and up-to-date understanding of the
enterprise's IT capabilities and resources and how they can be leveraged to support the enterprise's
goals.

questions.question:
Which of the following would be MOST appropriate for helping to detect sensitive information that is stored
on the enterprise hard drive(s) with inappropriate authorization or security controls?

options.A: intrusion detection system (IDS)
options.B: data loss prevention (DLP)
options.C: intrusion prevention system (IPS)
options.D: Transport Layer Security (TLS)

justifications.A:
Intrusion detection systems (IDS) identify some sensitive information using signatures built for that
purpose, but they are not as effective as data loss prevention (DLP) systems for detecting sensitive
information.
justifications.B:
Data loss prevention (DLP) systems identify sensitive information stored on endpoint systems or in
transit over a network.
justifications.C:
Intrusion prevention systems (IPSs) prevent sensitive information using signatures built for that purpose.
However, they do not identify sensitive information on endpoints or in transit.
justifications.D:
Transport Layer Security (TLS) is a network encryption protocol used to protect sensitive information,
but it does not have any ability to identify sensitive information.
176

questions.question: Which of the following BEST describes the primary objective of a data loss prevention (DLP) solution?

options.A: To prevent any data loss incidents within an enterprise
options.B: To detect and respond to data loss incidents within an enterprise
options.C: To mitigate the risk of data loss incidents within an enterprise
options.D: To encrypt data within an enterprise to prevent unauthorized access

justifications.A:
A data loss prevention (DLP) solution cannot prevent all data loss incidents, because some data loss
incidents may still occur despite the implementation of DLP controls.
justifications.B:
DLP helps to prevent unintentional or malicious data loss incidents, detect and respond to incidents
promptly, and minimize the impact of data loss incidents on the enterprise.
justifications.C:
The primary objective of a DLP solution is to mitigate the risk of data loss incidents by
implementing a range of preventive and detective controls, such as access controls, data
classification, encryption, monitoring and response procedures. These controls help prevent
unintentional or malicious data loss incidents, detect and respond to incidents promptly, and
minimize the impact of data loss incidents on the enterprise.
justifications.D:
DLP does not encrypt enterprise data; rather, it is used to mitigate the risk of data loss incidents by
implementing appropriate controls.

questions.question: Which of the following is the MOST effective way to prevent accidental data loss caused by employees?

options.A: Blocking access to all external websites and email domains
options.B: Encrypting all sensitive data on all storage devices within the enterprise
options.C: Conducting regular user awareness training programs
options.D: Implementing strict access controls to restrict employee access to sensitive data

justifications.A:
Blocking access to all external websites and email domains does not prevent all accidental data loss, such
as data backup taken following incorrect procedures. The most effective way to prevent such incidents is
to educate and train employees on the importance of data protection policies and procedures. Moreover,
blocking access to external websites and email domains may hinder business operations and productivity.
justifications.B: Encrypting all sensitive data on all storage devices may not be practical or necessary for all types of data.
justifications.C:
Accidental data loss caused by employees is a common occurrence in many enterprises. Regular
training and awareness programs can help employees understand their roles and responsibilities
in protecting sensitive data, identify potential risk and vulnerabilities, and take appropriate
measures to prevent data loss incidents. Employee training and awareness are critical to any data
protection strategy. Employees need to understand the value of the information that they handle,
the consequences of data loss and their role in data protection. Regular training and awareness
sessions should be conducted to keep employees updated about best practices for handling and
protecting data.
justifications.D:
Strict access controls can help prevent unauthorized access to sensitive data but may not address the risk
of accidental data loss caused by authorized users.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor observes a cryptocurrency miner on a staff member's computer linked
to their account. It is discovered that this is against IT policy. Which of the following would BEST help the
enterprise detect these issues sooner?

options.A: Reviewing the computer resources usability and activity report
options.B: Enforcing the software accreditation policy to control software installation
options.C: Organizing awareness workshops on IT policy periodically for users
options.D: Monitoring application logs using an automated log monitoring solution

justifications.A:
Cryptocurrency mining consumes a large amount of computing resources; therefore, regularly
reviewing usability and activity reports of computing resources will help to detect unauthorized
activity.
justifications.B:
Enforcing the software accreditation policy is a preventive control that will prevent similar incidents in
the future but cannot detect the already-implemented tools.
justifications.C: Awareness training will prevent future incidents but cannot help in detecting an incident.
justifications.D:
Although log monitoring helps in detecting, in this case, the tool is not authorized; therefore, the
cryptocurrency mining may not be collected by a log monitoring tool.
178

questions.question:
Which of the following is the MOST important factor for IT management to consider in developing
performance metrics?

options.A: Risk management and compliance with regulations
options.B: Key IT processes, including solution and service delivery
options.C: Business contribution, including financials
options.D: Critical processes in place to meet customer requirements

justifications.A: Risk and compliance with regulations is one of the dimensions of performance metrics.
justifications.B:
Key IT processes, including solution and service delivery, are one of the dimensions of performance
metrics.
justifications.C: Business contribution, including financials, is one of the dimensions of performance metrics.
justifications.D:
Identifying critical processes to meet customer requirements is one of the most important aspects of
developing performance metrics. Others are identifying specific, quantifiable outputs of work from
the identified processes and establishing targets against which results can be scored.

questions.question: An information systems (IS) auditor is performing a review of an organization's governance model. Which of the following should be of MOST concern to the auditor?

options.A: The information security policy is not periodically reviewed by senior management.
options.B: A policy ensuring systems are patched in a timely manner does not exist.
options.C: The audit committee did not review the organization's mission statement.
options.D: An organizational policy related to information asset protection does not exist.

justifications.A: Data security policies should be reviewed/refreshed once every year to reflect changes in the organization's environment. Policies are fundamental to the organization's governance structure, and, therefore, this is the greatest concern.
justifications.B: Although it is a concern that there is no policy related to system patching, the greater concern is that the information security policy is not reviewed periodically by senior management.
justifications.C: Mission statements tend to be long term because they are strategic in nature and are established by the board of directors and management. This is not the information systems (IS) auditor's greatest concern because proper governance oversight can lead to meeting the objectives of the organization mission statement.
justifications.D: Although it is a concern that there is no policy related to the protection of information assets, the greater concern is that the security policy is not reviewed periodically by senior management because top-level support is fundamental to information security governance.

questions.question: The initial step in establishing an information security program is:

options.A: developing and implementing an information security standards manual.
options.B: performing a comprehensive security control review by the information systems (IS) auditor.
options.C: adopting an enterprise information security policy statement.
options.D: purchasing security access control software.

justifications.A: The security program is driven by policy and the standards are driven by the program. The initial step is to have a policy and ensure that the program is based on the policy.
justifications.B: Audit and monitoring of controls related to the program can only come after the program is set up.
justifications.C: A policy statement reflects the intent and support provided by executive management for proper security and establishes a starting point for developing the security program.
justifications.D: Access control software is an important security control but only after the policy and program are defined.

questions.question: Which of the following user profiles should be of MOST concern to an information systems (IS) auditor when performing an audit of an electronic funds transfer system?

options.A: Three users with the ability to capture and verify their own messages
options.B: Five users with the ability to capture and send their own messages
options.C: Five users with the ability to verify other users and to send their own messages
options.D: Three users with the ability to capture and verify the messages of other users and to send their own messages

justifications.A: The ability of one individual to capture and verify their own messages represents an inadequate segregation because messages can be taken as correct and appear like they had already been verified. The verification of messages should not be allowed by the person who sent the message.
justifications.B: Users may have the ability to send messages but should not be able to verify their own messages.
justifications.C: This profile is an example of separation of duties. A person can send their own message but only verify the messages of other users.
justifications.D: The ability to capture and verify the messages of others but only send their own messages is acceptable.

questions.question: An organization has a well-established risk management process. Which of the following risk management practices would MOST likely expose the organization to the greatest amount of compliance risk?

options.A: Risk reduction
options.B: Risk transfer
options.C: Risk avoidance
options.D: Risk mitigation

justifications.A: Risk reduction is a term synonymous with risk mitigation. Risk reduction treats the risk, including compliance risk and lowers it to a level commensurate with the organization's risk appetite.
justifications.B: Risk transfer spreads the risk by either transferring some or all of it to a third party (e.g., through insurance or outsourcing) or applying the resources of multiple teams to hedge against possible losses. Risk transfer typically addresses financial risk and does not always address compliance risk.
justifications.C: Risk avoidance does not expose the organization to compliance risk because the business practice that caused the inherent risk to exist is no longer being pursued or is eliminated altogether.
justifications.D: While mitigating risk will still expose the organization to a certain amount of risk, risk mitigation lowers risk, including compliance risk, to a level commensurate with the organization's risk appetite.

questions.question: An enterprise is looking to obtain cloud hosting services from a cloud vendor with a high level of maturity. Which of the following is MOST important for the auditor to ensure continued alignment with the enterprise's security requirements?

options.A: The vendor provides the latest third-party audit report for verification.
options.B: The vendor provides the latest internal audit report for verification.
options.C: The vendor agrees to implement controls in alignment with the enterprise.
options.D: The vendor agrees to provide annual external audit reports in the contract.

justifications.A: Although the vendor is providing the most recent third-party audit report for review, there is no agreement contractually that requires the vendor to continue to provide annual reports for verification and review.
justifications.B: Although the vendor is providing the most recent internal audit report for review, there is no agreement contractually that requires the vendor to continue to provide annual reports for verification and review.
justifications.C: Without a clause in the contract, an agreement to implement controls does not provide assurance that controls will continue to be implemented in alignment with the enterprise.
justifications.D: The only way to ensure that any potential risk is mitigated today and in the future is to include a clause within the contract that the vendor will provide future external audit reports. Without the audit clause, the vendor can choose to forego future audits.

questions.question: An information systems (IS) auditor is evaluating the IT governance framework of an organization. Which of the following is the GREATEST concern?

options.A: Senior management has limited involvement.
options.B: Return on investment (ROI) is not measured.
options.C: Chargeback of IT cost is not consistent.
options.D: Risk appetite is not quantified.

justifications.A: To ensure that the IT governance framework is effectively in place, senior management must be involved and aware of their roles and responsibilities. Therefore, it is essential to ensure the involvement of senior management when evaluating the soundness of IT governance.
justifications.B: Managing return on investment (ROI) and thereby creating business value is a part of the objectives in the IT governance framework. Therefore, it is not effective in verifying the soundness of IT governance.
justifications.C: Introduction of a cost allocation system to facilitate the chargeback of IT cost to the applicable business units is part of the objectives in an IT governance framework. Therefore, it is not effective in verifying the soundness of IT governance.
justifications.D: Estimation of risk appetite is important; however, at the same time, management should ensure that controls are in place. Therefore, checking only on risk appetite does not verify soundness of IT governance.

questions.question: Which of the following would the auditor consider MOST important for effective data protection using a data loss prevention (DLP) solution?

options.A: Ensuring that a single administrator maintains the DLP to prevent data disclosures
options.B: Ensuring that the DLP solution is properly configured and implemented
options.C: Ensuring the effectiveness of the enterprise's DLP policies and procedures
options.D: Ensuring the effectiveness of the encryption and de-identification technologies

justifications.A: Data loss prevention (DLP) helps to protect the enterprise's sensitive data by applying different controls, and it does not need to be managed by a single administrator.
justifications.B: A DLP solution is only as effective as its configuration and implementation. If the DLP solution is not properly configured, it may not be able to detect or prevent sensitive data from being disclosed. Additionally, if the DLP solution is not properly implemented, it may be unable to enforce data protection policies effectively.
justifications.C: The biggest concern to an IS auditor is to identify whether the data loss prevention (DLP) solution is properly configured and implemented to meet the requirements of the enterprise's DLP policies and procedures.
justifications.D: The objective of DLP is not to encrypt or de-identify data; it is used to mitigate data loss incidents by implementing appropriate controls.

questions.question:
Which of the following BEST describes the focus of an information systems (IS) auditor when auditing the
enterprise architecture (EA)? The IS auditor should:

options.A: fallow the overall EA and use the EA as the main source of information.
options.B:
use the EA organizational requirements as the audit criteria to assess the conformity of the EA against
those requirements.
options.C: ensure that the information systems are in line with the EA and meet the enterprise's objectives.
options.D: review the EA documentation to assess whether the EA conforms with the enterprise's requirements.

justifications.A:
Different types of evidence should be collected from the enterprise architecture (EA) to assess its
conformity with the enterprise's requirements.
justifications.B:
Audit criteria should be established based on and derived from the enterprise's requirements to assess the
conformity of the EA against them.
justifications.C:
The aim of conducting an audit on the EA is to know whether information systems are in line with
the EA and meet the enterprise's objectives.
justifications.D:
EA documentation is one of many sources of information that the information systems (IS) auditor uses to
collect appropriate and sufficient evidence of conformity.
